This site was built with Hippo CMS.

Hutchison Technical built this demo and put it on GitHub as a useful launchpad for Hippo developers. This site is built on the principles of content reuse and is intended to be reusable in itself as a starting point for other projects based on Hippo CMS 7.7. The document content is comprised primarily of three major document types.

Text documents are the basic type of document provided by the Maven Archetype when a Hippo project is created. This page is a 'Text Document' and so is the homepage. They have nothing more than a title, summary, body text, and an image.

News documents build upon this by having a date timestamp. This is useful for news so that it can be listed in date order. I've added a topic property as well; I'll come back to that in a moment.

The article document is somewhat like a news article, except it isn't dated. They are not time-sensitive, so they don't need this information. They also have topics like news, and some additional information to display credits for images I've used from internet resources.

The 'topics' of these pages enables the author to assign what are basically tags to the document. The site uses these tags in two ways. Firstly it can list all the pages by tag, providing a natural navigation model. Secondly, it can pull in more content when displaying the page based on the topics. A secondary type of document has been created named 'Value Proposition' that also has been tagged with topics and has some text. An article shows all the text from these documents after the main body of the text, giving an opportunity to augment the content of the page with more general information that is directly relevant to the document. It's a fairly simple system but works well in practice, and can be enhanced by adding images and so on to the content included in the value propositions.

Design

The design of the site is intended to meet a few main goals:

  1. it originally conformed to a 960 grid system
  2. it has been retrofitted with media queries to enable a responsive design to work on mobile, tablet, and desktop
  3. it's the design I intend to use on my own website
  4. it should be trivial to replace this with your own visual styles
  5. I wanted to use images as links to articles where possible

When making your changes to the layout and CSS, the main aspects are replacing the single CSS file, adding static images to the project, and probably adding a logo image to the header. The site name is configured in the channel settings. You may also choose to add more social media items to the footer (although this isn't current best practice I think it works fairly well because of the CSS in place), and maybe change the footer text. 

Sort Order and Lists 

The sort properties and direction of sorting are set in the component interfaces as annotations on the methods. There's also other settings that can be done here, such as page size. I've set them up to meet my needs, but you might want to make changes depending on your requirements.
